concepts.name: Cinematography
concepts.description: The art and technique of capturing moving images on film or digital media.

concepts.name: Composition
concepts.description: The arrangement of visual elements within a frame, including placement of subjects, objects, and negative space.

concepts.name: Aspect Ratio
concepts.description: The proportional relationship between the width and height of an image, affecting the composition and framing of a shot.

concepts.name: Depth of Field
concepts.description: The area in focus in front of and behind a subject, controlled by aperture, focal length, and camera placement.

concepts.name: Key Lighting
concepts.description: The primary light source in a scene, used to create the overall mood and atmosphere.

concepts.name: Dolly Shot
concepts.description: A camera movement that involves moving the camera towards or away from a subject, often used to create a sense of intimacy or drama.
